item.title: Autism
item.description: Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) has been emerging as a major public health problem that has spread beyond the geographic, economic and social boundaries. Bangladesh is a lower middle-income country which has a population of more than 160 million. Against the backdrop of significant decline in child mortality (71% since 1990), the proportion of childhood disabilities including ASD appears to increase dramatically from 8% in 1988 to 20% in 2005 (The United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund (UNICEF, 2008).
